item.title: Need help whith threads what is a thread (Mod Taharok?)
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Dipset:

r0fl?!?!?!?!?!?!?!? hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahah

Get out of here if you are not going to help people:

RULE 4
4. We don’t make posts that contain not useful information. Posts like “cool”, “lol”, “yeah” and “I agree” don’t contain anything useful for others. We are not fans of off topic, unless it contains something smart or funny. Most of things spammers find funny are actually not funny at all.

abrammazal:

What is a thread? And how do you get them? Are they like serve ip’s? Ports? Thanks!

A thread is a topic that is on a fourm. It is pretty basic and simple. You can make one by clicking the button “Start a new Topic” in the upper right-hand-corner of the forums. A server IP is just someone else’s external IP address that is mainly distributed so that others can connect to it. In our cases, it is what to type in the Moparscape client to log onto that person’s private server. A port is just a “window” that is used to send information back and forth from network to network. Most people have to “Port Forward” because they are using routers and they need a specific port opened so that someone else can connect to it. If you do not see this message, it is ok, I will just pm this information to you anyways

Read full topic
